pullRequest.body:
closes #13276 
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9330294282/job/25683718099)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9330294282/job/25683717971)
Thanks for the PR. I have one high-level and one minor comment.

Since you're just printing a simple string, you don't need the `s!` macro.
```suggestion
    IO.println "Completed successfully!"
```
In fact, I wonder if it's nicer to combine these two lines, as in `IO.println s!"Unpacked in {(← IO.monoMsNow) - now} ms\nCompleted successfully!"`.

On a higher level: is this the best place to put this message? I would rather expect this line to be wherever the main logic of the `cache get` command is... (so, if some other step errors, you never get a "success" message from this later step, by design).

Thank you for the comments!
I assumed that errors cause the function to halt, then `unpackCache` won't be called. I'm not sure how the existence of errors is being checked, for instance at `getFiles` in `Cache/Requests.lean` or `main` in `Cache/Main.lean`. Do  you have any hints?

Good question! I don't know myself, so I took a look at the code.
The two previous functions exit the process (with exit code 1) if there's any error, so your assumption seems correct.
I added some documentation to this effect, and also a success message if only decompression was wanted.

nodes.title: `lake exe cache get` should print a better "success" message.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Cache): add success message to `lake exe cache get`
